snippet: After a majority of Croats voted to effectively ban same-sex marriages, Prime Minister Zoran Milanovic’s government pledged Monday to pursue a law allowing civil partnerships.
abstract: Croatian government pledges to press ahead with plans for a law allowing civil partnerships for gay people after a majority of Croats vote in a referendum to effectively ban same-sex marriage in the predominantly Catholic country.

byline.contributor: Ahmed Salihbegovic contributed reporting from Zagreb, Croatia.

lead_paragraph: After a majority of Croats voted to effectively ban same-sex marriages, Prime Minister Zoran Milanovic’s government pledged Monday to pursue a law allowing civil partnerships.

headline.main: Croatian Government to Pursue Law Allowing Civil Unions for Gay Couples
headline.print_headline: Croatia Says It Will Pursue Civil Unions

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
